greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..n} (-2)^i*B(i)*binomial(n,i) where B(n) = Bell numbers A000110(n).
comment: The sequence has strictly alternating signs. The variant Dobinski-type formula e^(-1)* (2)^n * sum( (k-1/2)^n / k!,k=0..infinity) is strictly positive. - _Karol A. Penson_ and _Olivier Gérard_, Oct 22 2007
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: G.f.: 1/U(0) where U(k)=  1 + x*(2*k+1) - 4*x^2*(k+1)/U(k+1) ; (continued fraction, 1-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 11 2012
mathematica: Table[ Sum[ (-2)^(k) Binomial[n, k] BellB[k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 50}] (* _Karol A. Penson_ and _Olivier Gérard_, Oct 22 2007 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 04 2007
